contentrichtext.text: [[File:Derbyheritagecent1.jpg|thumb|left|Photo showing the modern frontage of the building]] The Old [[Grammar school|Grammar School]], St. Peter's Churchyard, [[Derby]], [[England]], is now '''a Ladies Hairdressing Salon'''. The building's new owner is the daughter of the architect responsible for the original restoration of this historical property. All of the original features of the building have been retained and further extensive restoration work has been carried out at the new owner's expense. The Reverend [[John Cotton (puritan)|John Cotton]], a principal [[New England]] [[Puritan]] figure and a founder of [[Boston, Massachusetts]], was educated at [[Derby School]].<ref>see the blue plaque, pictured</ref> The Heritage Centre was established in 1992 by [[Richard Felix]], long time historian on popular [[Sky Living|Living]] show [[Most Haunted]] and is the starting point for Derby Ghost Walks. == References == {{reflist}} [[File:school blueplaque.jpg|thumb|left|Blue Plaque giving history of the Old Tudor Hall, St. Peter's Church Yard, Derby.]] [[File:derbyoldgrammar1.jpg|thumb|left|Photo showing the 15th century side view of the Old Tudor Hall in St. Peter's Church Yard]] {{coord|52.9204|-1.4771|type:landmark_region:GB|display=title}} {{UK-museum-stub}} [[Category:Buildings and structures in Derby]] [[Category:Buildings with blue plaques]] [[Category:Grade II* listed buildings in Derby]] [[Category:Visitor attractions in Derby]]
